means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 拉什 Ash的变体，由中世纪英语atter ashe(at the ash tree)误分音节而成

word_mean: 疹：皮肤上短暂出现的疹子，如荨麻疹、药疹和病毒疹
疹，发生于皮肤表面的斑丘状、粟粒状高出皮肤的疹子，抚之碍手，疹色可与皮肤颜色相同，亦可发红，疏密不一，甚则融连成片。

sentence.Network_en: He may break out in a rash when he eats these nuts.
sentence.Network_cn: 他吃了这些坚果可能会长皮疹。

sentence.Network_en: Don't do anything rash until the feel-ings subside.
sentence.Network_cn: 在冷静下来之前不要鲁莽行事。

sentence.Network_en: Mr. Major is making no rash promises.
sentence.Network_cn: 梅杰先生没有作出轻率的承诺。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (also in Scots and northern English in the sense 'nimble, eager'): of Germanic origin; related to German rasch
early 18th cent.: probably related to Old French rasche 'eruptive sores, scurf'; compare with Italian raschia 'itch'

entry.def: If someone is rash or does rash things, they act without thinking carefully first, and therefore make mistakes or behave foolishly.

example.ex: It would be rash to rely on such evidence...
example.tran: 依靠这样的证据是草率的。

example.ex: Mr. Major is making no rash promises...
example.tran: 梅杰先生没有作出轻率的承诺。

entry.def: A rash is an area of red spots that appears on your skin when you are ill or have a bad reaction to something that you have eaten or touched.

example.ex: I noticed a rash on my leg...
example.tran: 我发现我腿上长了疹子。

example.ex: He may break out in a rash when he eats these nuts...
example.tran: 他吃了这些坚果可能会长皮疹。

entry.tran: 大量，许多（令人不快的事情）
entry.def: If you talk about a rash of events or things, you mean a large number of unpleasant events or undesirable things, which have happened or appeared within a short period of time.

example.ex: They believe this confusion is responsible for a rash of suicides this spring.
example.tran: 他们认为今年春天一连串的自杀事件是由这次混乱引起的。

example.ex: ...one of the few major airlines left untouched by the industry's rash of takeovers...
example.tran: 没有受到行业内大量收购风波波及的少数几个重要航空公司之一

means.word_mean: 1. any red eruption of the skin
2. a series of unexpected and unpleasant occurrences;

sentences.sentence: "do something rash that he will forever repent"- George Meredith

means.word_mean: 2. marked by unthinking boldness; with defiant disregard for danger or consequences;

sentences.sentence: "foolhardy enough to try to seize the gun from the hijacker"
"became the fiercest and most reckless of partisans"-Macaulay
"a rash attempt to climb the World Trade Center"

means.word_mean: 太急速的; 鲁莽的; 轻率的

sentences.en: Don't be rash in making your decision.

jushi.english: I woke up covered in a rash.
jushi.chinese: 我醒来时长了一身疹子。

jushi.english: This is what happens when you make rash decisions.
jushi.chinese: 这就是你贸然做决定的后果。
